os.fullname: OS Portable (Source code to work with many OS platforms)
os.fullpath: Operating System :: Grouping and Descriptive Categories :: OS Portable (Source code to work with many OS platforms)

name: malty_DEPRECATED
short_description:
This code was written to solve a very basic but common problem in bioinformatics: given an alignment of sequence A to sequence B, and another alignment of B to C, transform those into an alignment of A to C.  By "alignment" I specifically mean an alignment that can be represented by a CIGAR string (see SAM/BAM format definition).

Download code snapshots here: http://sourceforge.net/projects/malty/files/

Or, get the bleeding-edge version from my Mercurial repository: http://sourceforge.net/p/malty/code/ref/default~/

Main project page: http://sourceforge.net/p/malty/wiki/Home/

Open tickets for bug/feature requests: http://sourceforge.net/p/malty/tickets/

Discussion forums (yes, I will read them): http://sourceforge.net/p/malty/discussion/
summary: translates alignments of A-to-B and B-to-C to A-to-C; has BAM support
